»Arhivov nimamo, zato kopljemo po zemlji«
02 Nov 2019, 08:40 by L. M., Bojan Vovk
Ljubljana, Kočevje - Pred dnevi je v prostorih Družine dr. Jože Dežman, predsednik vladne komisije za reševanje vprašanj prikritih grobišč, s sodelavci predstavil brezno pod Macesnovo gorico, v katerem so v globini približno dvajsetih metrov naleteli na posmrtne ostanke po vojni umorjenih.
Kot pravi Dežman: »Mi arhivov nimamo, zato kopljemo po zemlji.« Raziskovanje polpretekle zgodovine bodo nadaljevali prihodnje leto.
Na novinarski konferenci so sodelovali: speleolog dr. Andrej Mihevc, arheolog dr. Uroš Košir, predsednik komisije dr. Dežman in kriminalistični svetnik Pavel Jamnik.


Eno je ostanek lesene škatle za električne detonatorje,

Po besedah direktorja Komunale Kočevje Marka Kljuna so z delovnimi stroji od začetka avgusta do pred kratkim na površini 800 kvadratnih metrov izkopali tri tisoč kubičnih metrov materiala in naleteli na prve posmrtne ostanke. Jamar Bojan Vovk je iz jame, kjer so umirali ranjenci, prinesel dva predmeta: ostanek lesene škatle za električne detonatorje in ostanek žice, s katero so bili umorjeni zvezani.
Po Dežmanovem mnenju se zdaj odpirajo vprašanja: kdo je moril in miniral, ukazal umore in miniranje. Vse skupaj je zavito v tančico skrivnosti, saj tisti, ki bi o žrtvah morali kaj vedeti, vztrajno molčijo. Od tistih, ki so obstreljeni, a brez hujših ran preživeli padec v brezno, se jih je rešilo vsaj sedem. Njihova pričevanja zdaj povezujejo z letošnjimi odkritji v jami. Prav tako Macesnovo gorico kot morišče in grobišče Slovencev potrjujejo rezultati arheoloških in topografskih raziskav.

V Kočevski Rog odpeljanih najmanj 1.500 Slovencev



Pogled, verjetno prvi po 74 letih, v jamski prostor v jami pod Macesnovo gorico, kjer so umirali ranjenci.

O številu žrtev v jami še ugibajo. Dejstvo, da je bilo v vrtači pred breznom, kjer so žrtve slačili, v dveh raziskavah najdenih več kot 60 kilogramov predmetov, govori o velikem dogodku. Med drugim so našli 185 križcev, 146 svetinjic, številne pasne spone in druge dele opreme.
»Po zbranih podatkih je bilo v Kočevski rog odpeljanih najmanj 1500 Slovencev. Raziskava bo pokazala, koliko jih je bilo pobitih v jami pod Macesnovo gorico. Potem bomo vedeli, ali je potrebno še naprej iskati še eno jamo v območju Ušivih jam,« meni Dežman, ki je na podlagi izjave Zdenka Rotarja, da pozna vsaj enega od storilcev, v imenu komisije naslovil vprašanje o tem dogodku med drugim tudi na Zvezo združenj borcev za vrednote narodnoosvobodilnega boja Slovenije (ZZB NOB), vendar odgovora o morebiti še živečih udeležencih zločina ni prejel.
Kriminalistični svetnik Pavel Jamnik pravi, da je Kočevski rog sinonim za množične poboje na območju Slovenije, da kriminalisti v zadnjih dvajsetih letih niso odkrili morebitnih krivcev, a dokler bo obstajala možnost, da so priče dogodkov še žive, kriminalistična policija ne bo mirovala.
Kot je za časopis Delo povedal kočevski župan dr. Vladimir Prebilič, so morišča na njihovem območju dejstvo in da smo vsi skupaj predolgo gledali stran. »Žal nimamo vzvodov, da bi zgodovino spremenili, saj se taki dogodki po vojni ne bi smeli zgoditi. Upam, da bo vse skupaj potekalo skladno s pieteto,« pravi Prebilič.

Oteženo delo komisije

Komisija zdaj obravnava okoli 750 lokacij množičnih pomorov. Do konca lanskega leta je bilo raziskanih 233 grobišč in morišč, iz 129 je bil opravljen delni ali celotni prekop žrtev, v 104 primerih pa je bil s sondiranjem potrjen obstoj človeških skeletnih ostankov, nam je pojasnil Dežman. Dodaja, da so odkrili posmrtne ostanke vsaj 2532 oseb. Od teh jih je bilo pokopanih 1615, 162 grobišč in morišč je bilo v naravi.
Med raziskavami so doslej odkrili tudi več tisoč predmetov. Od sprejetja zakona o prikritih grobiščih je komisija za svoje delo vsako leto prejela po pol milijona evrov, v naslednjem proračunskem obdobju bodo prejemali 50.000 evrov manj. »Problem, na katerega bomo opozorili te dni, je, da nam pristojno ministrstvo oz. tajnik komisije ne zagotavljata pogojev za izvrševanje programa, ki ga je sprejela vlada. Zato nekaterih programskih točk ne moremo izpolniti in bo denar ostal neporabljen. Gre za administrativno dušenje dela komisije,« je prepričan Dežman.

"We don't have archives, so we dig around the earth"
02 Nov 2019, 08:40 by L. M., Bojan Vovk
Ljubljana, Kočevje - A few days ago, on the premises of the Family of dr. Joze Dezman, the Prime Minister of the Government Commission for the Surveillance of Covert Burial Grounds, and his colleagues presented the abyss below Macesnovo Gorica, in which, at the depth of about twenty meters, they found the remains of those killed after the war.
As Dežman says, "We have no archives, so we dig around the earth." They will continue their exploration of past history next year.
The press conference was attended by: speleologist dr. Andrej Mihevc, archeologist dr. Uroš Košir, chairman of the committee dr. Dezman and criminal councilor Pavel Jamnik.


One is the remnant of a wooden box for electric detonators,

According to the director of the Kočevje Commune, Mark Kljun, three thousand cubic meters of material were excavated by working machines from the beginning of August until recently, covering 800 square meters and encountering the first remains. Jamar Bojan Vovk brought two objects from the cave where the wounded died: the remnant of a wooden box for electric detonators and the remnant of the wire with which they were killed.
According to Dezman, questions now arise: who murdered and mined, ordered the murders and mined. The whole thing is wrapped in a veil of mystery, as those who should know something about the victims remain silent. Of those who have survived a fall into the abyss who have been shot but without serious wounds, at least seven have been rescued. Their testimonies now relate to this year's discoveries in the cave. Likewise, Macesnovo gorica, as a burial ground and burial ground for Slovenes, is confirmed by the results of archaeological and topographic research.

At least 1,500 Slovenians sent to Kočevska Rog



A view, probably the first after 74 years, into the cave space in the cave below Macesnov Gorica where the wounded died.

The number of casualties in the cave is still being speculated. The fact that more than 60 kilograms of objects were found in a sinkhole before the abyss where the victims were stripped down indicates a major event. Among other things, 185 crosses, 146 shrines, numerous belt clamps and other pieces of equipment were found.
»According to the collected data, at least 1500 Slovenes were taken to the Kočevski horn. The survey will show how many were killed in the cave beneath Macesen Hill. Then we will know whether it is necessary to continue to search for another cave in the Usa Caves area, "said Dežman, who, on the basis of Zdenko Rotar's statement that he knew at least one of the perpetrators, addressed a question about the event to the Union on behalf of the commission however, he did not receive a response on the potential survivors of the crime.
Criminalist councilor Pavel Jamnik says that the Kočevski horn is synonymous with mass killings in Slovenia, that criminals have not identified any culprits in the last 20 years, but as long as there is a possibility that the witnesses of the events are still alive, the criminal police will not rest.
According to the mayor of Kočevje, dr. Vladimir Prebilić, the killings in their area are a fact and we all looked away for too long. “Unfortunately, we do not have the leverage to change history, as such events should not happen after the war. I hope everything goes well with the pie, "says Prebilić.

Commission work difficult

The Commission is currently reviewing around 750 mass aid sites. By the end of last year, 233 cemeteries and burial grounds were investigated, out of 129 partial or total burial of victims was carried out, and in 104 cases the existence of human skeletal remains was confirmed by sounding, Dezman explained. He adds that the remains of at least 2532 people were discovered. Of these, 1615 were buried, 162 were buried in the wild.
Thousands of objects have been discovered so far during the research. Since the passage of the Covert Burial Act, the commission has received half a million euros each year for its work, and will receive 50,000 euros less in the next budget period. “The problem that we will be reminded of these days is that the ministry or the ministry is responsible for this. the secretaries of the commission do not guarantee the conditions for the implementation of the program adopted by the government. Therefore, some program points cannot be met and money will be left unused. It is an administrative stranglehold on the work of the commission, "Dezman believes.
